III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Former Youth B told Complainant that after he and other
unidentified youths returned from Absent With Out Leave (AWOL),
unidentified staff and other youths would beat them to near death
in the basement or gym.
Investigation Documents reviewed:
I was assigned this joint investigation with Government Worker 1
on 2/15/24.
MISACWIS indicated Former Youth B was admitted to Wolverine
Center on 10/11/23 and discharged on 1/11/24.
According to CA, Former Youth B never AWOLed from the facility
so there are no documents pertaining to this. There are also no
documents relative to other youths being beaten by youths or staff
after returning from AWOL between 10/11/23 – 1/11/24.
Interviews:
I notified Youth B’s Foster Care Worker of this investigation
assignment, and she expressed no licensing concerns regarding
Wolverine Center.
I contacted Complainant/Lotus Treatment Program Therapist, and
she expressed no additional licensing concerns.
On 2/15/24 Courtesy Worker interviewed Former Youth B’s Lotus
Treatment Program Occupational Therapist (OT). OT reported
Youth B has been at Lotus Treatment Program for one month and
she had no licensing concerns pertaining to Wolverine Center.
Courtesy Worker interviewed Former Youth B, age 13, privately at
Lotus Treatment Program in Grand Rapids. He was free of visible
2

marks and bruises on his skin. Former Youth B seemed
disinterested in speaking with Courtesy Worker. He said the
adults and residents at Wolverine Center would beat him up.
When asked for specific names of adults and residents, he
answered, “All of them” and he did not remember their names.
Former Youth B was asked what he meant by “beating him up.”
He replied, “Bruising.” He said they left bruises on him, and he
was not going to talk about what happened. He said a staff
member he could not identify was killed because Former Youth B
told someone. Former Youth B reported that every other kid at
Wolverine was beaten up too, but he was unwilling or unable to
state their names and did not know when these incidents
happened.
Chief Administrator (CA) reported while Former Youth B was at
the facility, he never AWOLed, was never involved a fight and
never beaten by other youths or staff.
Government Worker 1 and I requested names of other youths who
AWOLed between 10/11/23 – 1/11/24.
I interviewed Youth N jointly with Government Worker 1 at school
on 2/26/24. He presented as lethargic and had difficulty spelling
his first name. Youth N said he was admitted to Wolverine Center
in December 2023. He said he AWOLed once to get a soda and
was gone for a couple of hours. When he returned from AWOL,
Youth N said staff checked his pockets and he went to his room.
He denied ever being in a fight or being beaten by other youths at
the facility.
I interviewed Youth T jointly with Government Worker 1 at school
on 2/26/24. He has been at the facility since December 2023 and
said he AWOLed three times. Once he walked downtown and
was returned by law enforcement. Twice, he walked around the
block after dark and returned on his own. Each time he returned
from AWOL, Youth T said staff searched him in the front office.
He was unaware of anyone being taken to the gym or basement
and beaten upon returning from AWOL.
I interviewed Youth J jointly with Government Worker at school on
2/26/24. He has been at the facility since October 2023. Youth J
said he AWOLed a few times “just to get some air for an hour or
so” and returned on his own. Upon returning from AWOL, Youth J
said he was searched in the doorway and sometimes “got
medically cleared at the hospital” or drug screened if staff
3

suspected substance use. He said he had never heard of any
youth being beaten after returning from AWOL.
I attempted to interview Youth M jointly with Government Worker 1
at school, but he refused.
I interviewed Youth S jointly with Government Worker 1 at the
facility on 2/26/24. He said he AWOLed once with another youth
who is now discharged. They went to a gas station after dark and
when they returned, they were searched and wanded by staff then
taken to a hospital to be medically cleared. When they returned to
the facility, Youth S said he went back to his room. He denied
ever hearing of other youths being beaten by staff or youths after
returning from AWOL.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 on 2/26/24.
She has worked at the facility for two years. Government Worker
1 asked about the process for youth’s returning from AWOL. She
said a male staff shakes their shirt, shoes and socks in the lobby.
The youths are asked to pat themselves down to show they have
no contraband. A wand or metal detector may also be used.
Youths are then taken to the hospital to be medically cleared.
When the youth return to the facility, they rejoin the group. Staff 1
denied ever seeing or hearing of youths or staff beating other
youths related to AWOLing or returning from AWOL. She said
she has never seen any staff beat a youth in the basement, gym
or anywhere else.
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis Former Youth B resided at Wolverine Center from 10/11/23 –
1/11/24. He told Courtesy Worker that he and “every kid” there
were beaten by “all” of the adults and residents and that he
sustained bruises. When Courtesy Worker observed him on
2/15/24, Former Youth B was free of marks and bruises. Former
Youth B could not remember the names of the youths or staff
involved and was unwilling to talk about it. He said an unidentified
staff member was killed because he told someone something.
CA had no knowledge or documentation of Former Youth B
AWOLing, being involved in any fights or beaten by staff or other
youths while he was at the facility.
Four other youths who had AWOLed and returned during the time
Former Youth B resided at Wolverine Center denied ever being
4

beaten by staff or other youths in the gym, basement or anywhere
else.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
